biography: I'm a filmmaker at heart (and mostly in profession), but I enjoy anything that let's me be creative. I play the drums, and I love music. I love Wakeboarding, Wakeskating, Rock Climbing, Street Hockey, and recently just good old fashion running, but I’m not very good at any of them. I put my mind to work on contemplating theories and the structure behind the art of story, and I like to imagine I know a thing or two about physics, and philosophy. I’m fascinated with space and stars, and hope I live long enough to see the first man land on Mars!

biography: My name is Lance T. Miller and I am a playing card designer and freelance illustrator. I am originally from Maryland, USA moved to Nashville TN where I now live with my wife, two crazy dogs, and a very weird cat. My work has recently graced a deck of Bicycle brand playing cards and I'm on a mission to build a deck designing empire. It is my goal to create a community around deck design and involve the people who buy the decks in the design process. By allowing some creative input from the community, the decks can evolve and take on a new life that we build together.
name: Lance T. Miller

biography: No one has ever accused me of being normal.I grew up with two pianos and half a dozen violins.  I own two pairs of tap shoes.  I have sung with the San Francisco Opera, San Francisco Symphony, and on the same program as Danny Kaye.  I am on the board of directors for a local teen theatre company.  I have a recording studio packed away in the attic.I have been a Land Rover Owner and will be again some day.  I have led backpacking trips for the Sierra Club.  I was a swim teacher.  I own hiking boots, water shoes, and climbing shoes.I make really good fried rice, chicken matzo ball soup (my mother-in-law's recipe), and Thai yellow curry.  I am fairly knowledgeable about Japanese bathroom design.I have written professionally for several well-known parenting websites as well as a holiday-themed website.  I have written several children's books and am working towards getting them published.  I currently write, sporadically, at SafariDad.com.I have more than thirty years' experience as a computer programmer.  I collect vintage portable computers and have a highly-regarded collection.I have long been active in the fight for full civil rights, including marriage equality, for the LGBT community.I am married and have three children.  We live in San Francisco in the house in which I grew up, a stone's throw from the site of the orphanage where my father grew up.Since having children, my role as father has become an integral part of my identity.  Everything I do or hope for or feel is colored by the presence of my children.  My dreams of driving my Land Rover through Europe and Africa have morphed into visions of a family safari.  My writing has changed from hard science fiction to children's books and parenting issues.  My political activism has become focused on education and securing rights for LGBT Families.My chess set is made of LEGOs.

biography:
Jason is the Founder, Owner, and Chair of MaricopaCon 2010, 2012, and 2013-2019. He was Co-Chair for Conflagration 2012 at Tempe Mission Palms.  He was the Gaming Director for LepreCon 36, LepreCon 37, CopperCon 30, and DarkCon 2014. Jason is a recurring GameMaster at RinCon, AZ Game Fair, LepreCon, and CokoCon.  He runs game demos for GreaterThanGames, Monte Cook games, and Forbidden Games.
Jason is a software engineer at Intel by day, and a visual artist at night.  He has also written several RPGs and even a poetry book.  His paintings have been in 16 Phoenix art shows over the past seven years.
